com.mashery.http

Interface MutableParamIterator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterator<String>, ParamIterator
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableHTTPHeaderElementIterator, MutableHTTPHeaderIterator

    public interface MutableParamIterator
extends ParamIterator
    Mutable iterator for parameters. Adds support for adding, updating, and removing.
    See Also:
    MutableParamGroup
    Restriction
    This interface is not intended to be implemented by clients.
    Restriction
    This interface is not intended to be extended by clients.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(String name, String value)
      Adds a new parameter just before the parameter that would be returned by Iterator.next().
      void remove()
      Removes the current parameter from the group.
      void set(String name, String value)
      Sets the name and/or value of the current parameter.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mashery.http.ParamIterator

        value

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Iterator

        hasNext, next

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        void remove()
            throws IllegalStateException
        Removes the current parameter from the group. This method can be called only once per call to next. The behavior of an iterator is unspecified if the underlying group is modified while the iteration is in progress in any way other than by calling this method.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Iterator<String>
        Specified by:
        remove in interface ParamIterator
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        Iterator.remove()

      • set

        void set(String name,
       String value)
         throws IllegalStateException,
                IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the name and/or value of the current parameter. May only be called after Iterator.next(). Must not be called after add(String, String) or remove().
        Parameters:
        name - new name
        value - new value
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no current parameter
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the name or the value are not allowed

      • add

        void add(String name,
       String value)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new parameter just before the parameter that would be returned by Iterator.next().
        Parameters:
        name - parameter name
        value - parameter value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the name or the value are not allowed
